intro: Stenocalyx gardnerianus, commonly known as the African snowball, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, spherical clusters of white flowers that resemble snowballs. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers bloom in late winter to early spring, making it a valuable addition to gardens in regions with mild winters. The plant is also noted for its ability to thrive in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade conditions.
